paragraphs.text: Simper while you sing. The ghastly Ed Sheeran effect.
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: Looking at what's seriously wrong with the world today, it definitely isn't Ed Sheeran
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: However
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: looking at what's wrong with British music today, it almost definitely is Ed Sheeran
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: When the Brit nominations were recently announced, much of the focus was rightly on how "white" they were
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: similar to the Oscars
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: However
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: for me, this was not the only reason why the Brit nominations were unsettling
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I was also disturbed by the fact that Ed received multiple nominations, including best album and solo artist
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: I know it's only the Brits, but come on people
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: how far do we intend to go with this?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I'm no musical snob
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I dislike pomposity about mainstream musical tastes
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I even think The X Factor is a hoot, and have written on how it's more colour blind than other parts of the entertainment industry (a point reinforced by the recent nominations)
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: My stance has always been: calm down
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: , there' s room for everybody, right?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: However
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: it's as though Ed Sheeran has gone from being an artist to a syndrome, an effect, even a pox, and he/it is everywhere
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: There Ed is, performing on television shows, peddling his simpering vanilla-sound
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: At the Victoria's Secret fashion show, giggling at the ladies in bras like the last boy-virgin standing at freshers' week
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Ed, whose whiny music makes him sound as though he's got his tongue permanently trapped in a child safety gate
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Who looks as though you'd get up close and he'd smell of Violet Bloom Febreze
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Whose lukewarm monotones I fervently feel should be banned in cars
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: lest motorists are overcome with ennui and fatally fall asleep at the wheel
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The other odd thing is that Ed, with his inane grin and funky waistcoats, is completely sexless- exuding all the carnal charisma of a pyjama case
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Sam Smith (another multiple Brit nominee) isn't much better
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: though he gets extra points for being gay, and being able to sing, instead of doing what Ed does
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: - whimpering like a dog thrown down a well
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Is being unthreatening the point of Ed?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: That he's a good musical starter-crush for little girls who might find One Direction too frightening?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: If so, where' s the gender parity?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: How come the likes of Sheeran are rewarded for being undersexualised
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: while most of the women in his industry are oversexualised - some because they want to be, others because they are told to
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: all of them aware that the pressure is on
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: While there are always exceptions
paragraphs.label: common-ground

paragraphs.text: everyone knows that females are more likely to be coerced into using their sexuality
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: What's interesting is that now there's this corresponding bizarre inversion with males getting less and less sexy
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: until finally we arrive at the industry "norm" of Sheeran, a parentally approved pop boy-dolly
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: who comes with guitar accessories, and makes nice soothing noises
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: when you pull a string in his back
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Some might say it's what the audience demands
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: isn't it more about being told what to want?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It seems unlikely that the same audience digging Ed's mellow vibe are demanding that equivalent female artists appear scantily clad, hellbent on fellating the microphone
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Do we truly believe that people sit at home saying:"Well, I'm not listening to this - she's got all her clothes on and hasn't once pretended to orgasm,"?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In short
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: does it occur to anyone that Sheeran's banality, the very fact that he's permitted to be so banal, is a profoundly chauvinist fact in itself?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Will we ever see a day when women would be rewarded for being as unsexy as Ed?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: What about all the Eds he's inspiring
paragraphs.label: other

paragraphs.text: who are waiting in the wings
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: will it ever end?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Ed Sheeran might be the nicest guy in the world
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: it's time that "Ed Sheeran", the effect and the pox, was identified and stopped
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Without meaning to be alarmist, I fear that there may be a royal clothes shortage
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Kate, duchess of Cambridge, has always been congratulated for wearing (and re-wearing) high-street fashion
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Since becoming pregnant, she's won yet more plaudits for wearing non-maternity items
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The whole thing has become overdone to the point where one could become seriously concerned that the duchess might not have enough clothes
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: A national embarrassment
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: We can't have our queen-to-be scrabbling around for some decent threads
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Perhaps we should all rifle through our wardrobes and donate something
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I've got a couple of bits she could have
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: the hems have come down
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: I'm not sure if she's into "vintage ASOS", huge flower prints or suspicious stains
paragraphs.label: other

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: in her situation she can't afford to be too picky
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I also need to know Kate's shoe size
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: it seems only fair that the gesture is reciprocated
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: I'm wondering if she has any furry Crocs I could borrow for the spring season?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Obviously I'm being facetious, but does the duchess really have to be congratulated for doing what every woman does
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: which is to wear her clothes more than once?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Google Glass (the "smart" eyewear that made Joe Bloggs resemble Joe 90) is being phased out
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The focus will now be on future versions of Glass, with the company feeling that the project "allowed us to learn what's important to consumers and enterprises alike"
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: Which appears to be corporate-speak for:"We belatedly realised that everyone felt like complete berks wearing them."
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I don't pretend to be cutting-edge in any way
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I'm one of life's late adopters
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: which means that I watch other people go through teething problems with new technology
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: while I stand on the sidelines looking gormless, occasionally jeering and feeling vindicated
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: when things go wrong
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Like now, for instance
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: It's not pretty
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: it works for me
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: With Google Glass, I didn't have long to wait
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Even I could see that specs- with-screens was a non-starter and that the Nathan Barley-esque marketing line:"Your chance to walk down the high street, watching pointless stuff with one eye while looking like a prize tit" was never going to be a winner with the masses
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Commiserations to those
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: who spent close to
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: 1,000 on the wearable tech, produced under the Explorer programme
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: expecting
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: it to develop further
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: I would tell them not to be bitter
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: they should feel proud of their early adopting ways
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Many moons ago, there would have been people investing in inventors who wanted to fly, who ran about fields flapping big fake wings, before presumably being gently escorted to a nearby asylum
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In time, this led to aeroplanes
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Thus Google Glass purchasers can at least have the satisfaction of knowing that they were pioneers - the flint that created the spark that lit the fire
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Or
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: whatever
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: analogy tech mugs prefer
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: to make
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: them feel better about
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: being a grand lighter
paragraphs.label: no-unit
